name: Fairfield Inn Denver Cherry Creek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great 2 night stop over on a long road trip. Marriott rarely disappoints, and this location is no exception. Superior service, immaculate rooms, and great location near the freeway, downtown, shopping, and a variety of great restaurants. The only downside is the somewhat scary one-way parking garage, and the smaller than usual bathrooms. Otherwise it was pretty close to perfect!
reviews.title: Super stay!

reviews.text: The Fairfield Inn is located right off of I-25 at the intersection of Colorado Blvd and Mexico Ave. The actual hotel fronts Colorado Blvd but the entrance is off of Mexico Ave. The entrance is a a little tricky so you have to look for it right after you turn on to Mexico Ave. There is a multi-level parking garage which is a bit tight but each level has a secure entrance to the hotel which is nice. The Fairfield serves up a nice free daily breakfast. Never underestimate the saving of free breakfast! We stayed in a 2 bed standard room which overlooked Colorado Blvd. There was a little street noise but you had a view of the Rocky Mountains. Your alternative? Stay across the the hall for a little less noise and a view of the parking deck and Best Buy. I'll take the mountain view. For access to the main North/South highway of Colorado and downtown Denver the Fairfield Inn is a great place to stay and rest your head. You're in Denver! With a thousand things to see and do who sits around in their hotel room anyway!
reviews.title: Comforatble Room. Convenient location.
Nice hotel!
reviews.text: We only stayed 1 night night and was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff, from the front desk clerks to the people working the breakfast room. Everyone went out of there way to make our stay a pleasent one. The room was very clean and comfortable with a nice view of the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains. The free continental breakfast was very nice and the very well stocked. The parking was a little tight and squeezed between a gas station and other buildings, but it was free and covered. The only reason I didn't give it a perfect rating was because of the tightness of its location with no room to park when registering.
I stayed at this inn when moving my son into the University of Denver. The room was clean, the staff was very helpful and friendly, and the price $89/night was more than reasonable.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn offers good value for your money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Local calls are free, and there is free internet access/printing. Also, we had packages shipped ahead of us, and they cheerfully agreed to store for a few days until we arrived. The drive to the university is 5 mins from the inn, and we drove to downtown Denver in about 15 mins on a Sunday evening.
reviews.title: Great value if you just need somewhere to sleep

reviews.text: The room was really spacious and comfortable. Had a one-bedroom suite, which gave some extra privacy while travelling with kids.
reviews.title: Spacious, comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was small, but well-heated. Bonus for the freak April blizzard.
reviews.title: Amazing Service & Great Location

reviews.text: Common areas appeared to be freshly redocorated and are very tasteful. However, there were a few maintenance issues, like burnt out lights and non-functioning exterior locks.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, Good Value

likes.liked: — Location close to Univ. of Denver

reviews.text: I do echo other reviewers' comments about the tight parking garage. I'm an urbanite, so I don't usually complain about tight parking, but given the barge that Hertz rented me, I found it a little nerve-racking.
reviews.title: Good value for this part of town

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend in Sept. We were vacationing in Denver to see the Denver Broncos & Colorado Rockies play back-to-back. We chose to stay at the Fairfield due to price, proximity to the Light Rail and easy public transport from the airport. At first glance on the map it looks like it would be inconvenient but it's not. You can take the SkyRide from the airport (AF Route - $7 each way) and transfer at Colorado BLVD to the public city bus (Route 40 - free transfer) which takes you right to the Fairfield. From there you can get to all the stadiums very easily via Light Rail ($1.75 each way - 5-10 minute walk). We would have preferred to stay in the heart of downtown but the price was almost double to stay in the city.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Friendly staff. Parking garage is very tight. Be alert when going up and down the ramps...use the mirrors posted. The third level of the garage has wider spots if you have a larger vehicle. The room is small but nice. In a popular area of town. It seemed that the hotel was squeezed on to a tiny lot behind a gas station so every inch was needed. My only complaint was that at 3-4 a.m. they had the fire dept testing the fire alarm so we were wakened by a voice telling us that we should stay in our rooms and it was only a test followed by the alarm going off, this happened twice in a matter of minutes as they tried to resolve some problem. Not sure why this had to happen in the middle of the night. Booked my reservation at denver.org and got promotional $52.80 rate so it was a good value.
reviews.title: tight quarters

reviews.text: We stayed here while in Denver for my daughters 2 days of Dr appointments at Childrens hospital. We got in late, had no trouble with checking in and our room was ready, clean. Is a no smoking hotel which was gr8, no signs of smoking anywhere. The pool was pool, but perfect for a family of 5 if you are the only one in it. The room we had was small, but for $52 a night it was perfect.
reviews.title: Will stay again

reviews.text: The thing that we liked the best and will make us return again and again was the staff. everyone went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable. You couldnt into the lobby without a huge smile and being asked if your needs we being met and if there was anything you needed.
reviews.title: Hotel served it's purpose. Would stay here again.

reviews.text: Have stayed at a lot of high cost hotels. But have never been treated like royality as we were here.
reviews.title: Good Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel was right off I-25. Clean, comfortable. breakfast was good (nothing fancy, but good options- waffles!). Service was great! About 15 min to downtown, easy access to Light Rail, which takes you straight to downtown. Neighborhood malls across street. Perfect if planning on site seeing, and just returning to hotel to sleep. Swimming pool small, but clean. Park for free.
reviews.title: Horrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location for univ of denver access. have stayed here many times over the past 2 years. am a frequent user of marriott properties around the country. hotel staff is young and very service oriented. for the extra 10-20 dollars stay in a "suite" for a little more room. breakfast room is very busy , particularly when there is a gathering at the university, selections are limited but adequate. property is clean, will stay there whenever we visit university of denver.
reviews.title: predictable, value oriented marriott with a very pleasant staff

reviews.text: We went with a group of families so we would be close to Dave and Busters (2 blocks away) and then we could come back to the pool afterwards and wear the kids out and visit. The pool is small. The pool room is freezing and the kids could only be in there for 20 minutes. We asked if they could heat the room up but the humidity regulator only would allow it to get to that temp. (60 degrees). Brr. Lobby had a fireplace and we had to adjorn out there because the kids were so cold. Lobby was small. The front desk was understanding and let us visit for 2 hours in the lobby and make all kinds of ruckus. We appreciated their tolerance. Rooms were nice. Bathroom was average size. I would not recommend this hotel for the pool and kids.
reviews.title: Met our needs, don't go for the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights, the first night was horrible, the second night was GREAT, that is why I gave it an average rating. Suggestion, request a room not on Colorado Blvd. if you are a light sleeper. Sorry so long, but you should know this before booking.
reviews.title: Great Employee Service

reviews.text: First night had a king room facing Colorado Blvd. with a door to an adjoining room. I slept about 3 hours that night, my worst night ever in a hotel. I could here the tv from the guy next door like I was in the room. watching Tim Russert. He finally turned the tv off at 11:30. Then there was the noise of Colorado Blvd. it was like I had the window slightly open. Police cars and ambulances all night, along with regular traffic noise. The guy next door turned the tv on at 6 am, so I was up.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn Good Value

reviews.text: The next moring I went to the front desk, asked to be moved to a room not on Colorado Blvd. Hillary (great employee service), moved us to a suite across the hall. The suite is a nice size. I would recommend the suites. I fell a sleep at 6:30 p.m. that night because I was so tired from the night before. I slept like a baby that night. So the employee service is GREAT at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good, but been in better

aka: Fairfield Inn Denver Cherry Creek Hotel Denver
description: Welcome to the newly-renovated Fairfield Inn & Suites Denver Cherry Creek. Set in the prestigious Denver suburbs off I-25, this hotel is nearby Denver University, the Cherry Creek Mall & Shopping Center, and only 15 minutes from Downtown Denver. The brand new lobby features a full-service business center, free WiFi, and a 24-hour market offering a variety of snacks, drinks, and sundries for the guest’s convenience. The remodeled hotel suites are highlighted by Marriot Luxury Bedding, free high-speed Internet access, a spacious work desk, and flat-screen TVs with premium cable. Upgrade to one of our signature king suites with separate living areas, a mini-refrigerator, microwave, and pull-out sofa bed. Our hotel also offers an indoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness center, as well as a daily Early Eats® complimentary continental breakfast, featuring Belgian waffles and Dannon® yogurts.
